dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Eight-thirty a.m.—that's the proposed new start time for government offices in Astana to help with traffic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eight-thirty a.m.-that's the proposed new start time for government offices in Astana to help with traffic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One proposal under review suggests that government bodies, budget-funded institutions, and municipal services could begin their workday at 8:30 a.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, Zhenis Kassymbek, the city's akim, mentioned that, didn't he? They're really trying to stagger work hours.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, Zhenis Kassymbek, the city's akim, mentioned that, didn't he? They're really trying to stagger work hours.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Authorities in Astana are considering adjusting the start times for certain organizations in an effort to ease traffic congestion during peak hours, according to the akim (governor) of the capital, Zhenis Kassymbek.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they're doing this big traffic flow analysis across all the districts right now. It's supposed to wrap up by the end of the month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they're doing this big traffic flow analysis across all the districts right now. It's supposed to wrap up by the end of the month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Speaking on the sidelines of an event at Akorda, Kassymbek said that a traffic flow analysis is currently underway across various districts of the city. He added that the analysis is expected to be completed by the end of the month, and if a decision is made, an announcement could be made in August.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it makes sense. If you shift some sectors to start earlier, you kinda spread out that morning rush before 9 a.m.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it makes sense. If you shift some sectors to start earlier, you kinda spread out that morning rush before nine a.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He pointed out that some places in the city already start at 8 a.m., so it's not even a totally new idea for Astana.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He pointed out that some places in the city already start at eight a.m., so it's not even a totally new idea for Astana.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, some institutions and companies in our city already operate from 8 a.m., and that's perfectly fine, Kassymbek noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's got precedent globally too—like, other major cities use staggered hours to cut down on congestion. It's a pretty standard move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's got precedent globally too-like, other major cities use staggered hours to cut down on congestion. It's a pretty standard move.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such practices are widely used around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think people will actually go for it though? Changing routines can be tough, especially if you're used to a certain schedule.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think people will actually go for it though? Changing routines can be tough, especially if you're used to a certain schedule.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, if it means shorter commutes and less time stuck in traffic, I feel like a lot of folks would be on board. Public transport would definitely benefit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, if it means shorter commutes and less time stuck in traffic, I feel like a lot of folks would be on board. Public transport would definitely benefit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This would ease the burden on public transport and roads leading up to 9 a.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's true. And he did mention that the LRT trains have started arriving, so maybe it's part of a bigger transportation overhaul.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's true. And he did mention that the L R T trains have started arriving, so maybe it's part of a bigger transportation overhaul.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Zhenis Kassymbek announced that the first light rail transit (LRT) trains had arrived in Astana.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the light rail transit—that's huge. Combined with schedule changes, it could really make a difference in peak hour gridlock.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the light rail transit-that's huge. Combined with schedule changes, it could really make a difference in peak hour gridlock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: We'll have to see what they decide after the analysis. He said an announcement could come as early as August if they move forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: We'll have to see what they decide after the analysis. He said an announcement could come as early as August if they move forward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that the analysis is expected to be completed by the end of the month, and if a decision is made, an announcement could be made in August.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Fingers crossed it works. Astana's growing so fast, something's gotta give with all these cars on the road.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fingers crossed it works. Astana's growing so fast, something's gotta give with all these cars on the road.
